characteristics.$text:
UT=Unit Type
HP=Hitpoints
DEF=Defense
MS=Melee Skill
BS=Ballistic Skill
M=Movement
D=Discipline
W=Willpower
Int=Intelligence
Ini=Initiative
S=Strength
T=Toughness
RWS=Ranged Weapon Slot
MWS=Melee Weapon Slot
characteristics.name: Description

rules.description:
A Unit is a collection of multiple models acting as one, and starts the game as such.
When chosen to activate, every model in the unit activates at once and must perform the same action type.
At the end of their activation, they must be in Coherency of one another; Coherency is equal to their Movement value.
At the start of their activation, if a model in the squad is out of Coherency, the Unit becomes Scattered.
rules.name: Coherency

characteristics.$text:
Any Model within 1 inch of a ledge or pushed off of a ledge that is more than half their movement value. When a Model or a Model in a unit is moved back, which would result in them being pushed off an edge, or uses a movement action within 1 inch of a ledge, they must take an Initiative Test.


Failure: The Model is placed at the bottom of the ledge they fell off of. They suffer a X WPN Dice AP0 Damage:1 MS:Y skill attack; X and Y are equal to the height in inches they fell. 


Succession: The Model does not fall off the edge and can move up to 1 inch away from the ledge. If they are still near the ledge at the start of their next activation, they do not need to perform a test when they move at all; the effect of this immunity ends at the end of their activation.
characteristics.name: Description

characteristics.$text:
When a Unit suffers 50%  Casualties of it's total model strength or when a Model (By itself) is at Half or Less HP, they roll a d6 and gain a Mental Status depending on the roll.

1: Stunned
2: Suppressed
3: Pinned
4-5: Performs a Fall Back Action
6:Nothing Occures
characteristics.name: Description

characteristics.$text:
When a Unit suffers 50% Casualties of it's total model strength or when a Model (By itself) loses half or more HP in a single Shooting Action or Melee Combat, at the end, they must take a Willpower Test. If they fail, they gain a Status Effect below on a d6:
1-3: They Perform a Fall Back Action.
4-6: They Gain Panic!
characteristics.name: Description

characteristics.$text:
A Fear Test does not have it's own independent clause, rather things such as Special Rules, Clauses and Events will cause it. The Model/Unit(s) involved in a fear test must roll a d6, and gain a status effect below:
1-2: They gain Death-Rattle for d3 Activations.
3-4: They gain Panic.
5-6: They perform a Fall-Back Movement.
characteristics.name: Description

characteristics.$text:
Actions


Models typically have two actions per activation(alternate activations), unless specified otherwise. These actions can be spent on any combination of the following:


For example, one unit during your turn would do two actions (If able), then the enemy would go and activate one of their’s, repeat until none is left for that round. Then start the next round.


If you have taken a unit, each model in that unit must perform the same action as they no longer act independently.


Combat Actions:


Ascension: You may ascend one floor, this costs all remaining actions in an activation.
Descension: You may descend one floor, this costs all remaining actions in an activation.
Melee Attack (MS): Engage in melee combat using your unit's MS.
Ranged Attack (BS): Fire a ranged weapon using your unit's BS.
Psychic Attack (PS): Use abilities or effects tied to psychic or magic powers (if applicable).
Objective Action: Interact with game objectives, such as capturing points, disarming devices, or other scenario-based tasks.


Movement: Move the unit up to its listed Move value. Units may perform this action twice per turn if desired.


Passive Morale Test: Resolve morale checks as required by game conditions.


Overwatch: A special, out-of-turn reaction. This action can be triggered if the unit has not activated this turn or ends its activation with one action remaining, requiring line of sight to do so. Overwatch can be used during the following:
An enemy unit charges this unit
An enemy unit performs a (BS) attack at this unit.
An enemy unit performs a (MS) attack at this unit, can only be used by (PISTOL) weapons.


Charge: Allows a unit to its 1.5 times (Original plus Half) movement distance and immediately perform a melee attack if an enemy is within range.
characteristics.name: Description

sharedRules.description:
When a Model or a Model in a unit is moved back, which would result in them being pushed off an edge, or uses a movement action within 1 inch of a ledge, they must take an Initiative Test.


Failure: The Model is placed at the bottom of the ledge they fell off of. They suffer a X WPN Dice AP0 Damage:1 MS:Y skill attack; X and Y are equal to the height in inches they fell. 


Succession: The Model does not fall off the edge and can move up to 1 inch away from the ledge. If they are still near the ledge at the start of their next activation, they do not need to perform a test when they move at all; the effect of this immunity ends at the end of their activation.
sharedRules.name: Initiative Edge Test

sharedRules.description: +1 to WPN Dice when performing a Shooting Action within half range of this weapon's profile.
sharedRules.name: Ballistic

sharedRules.description: Gain +1 To Ballistic Skill during a Shooting Action if this Model/Unit has not moved this activation. This weapon fills 1 Ranged Weapon Option on a model.
sharedRules.name: Rifle

sharedRules.description: A model with this weapon may choose to attack again after concluding a shooting action; two shooting actions in one action. However that model cannot move after shooting a second time.
sharedRules.name: Automatic

sharedRules.description: A Pistol may be used while in Melee Combat. A Pistol has the Moving Fire(0) rule. A singular pistol does not occupy a Ranged Weapon Slot, two Pistols do occupy a Ranged Weapon Slot.
sharedRules.name: Pistol

sharedRules.description: When this unit performs a movement action, it may use a weapon with Moving Fire (X) during it's movement, and may target and perform a shooting action against any valid enemy model/unit from the start to end of it's movement action. The Shooting action (BS) is reduced by (X).
sharedRules.name: Moving Fire(X)

sharedRules.description: A Submachine Gun has the Moving Fire(1) rule.This weapon fills 1 Ranged Weapon Option on a model.This weapon fills 1 Ranged Weapon Slot on a model.
sharedRules.name: Submachine Gun

sharedRules.description: This weapon does not trigger overwatch as result of being targeted by a (BS) weapon. Past half range of this weapon's profile, suffer -1 BS when you perform a shooting action.
sharedRules.name: Needle

sharedRules.description:
A Model equipped with a Blast Radius Weapon selects one enemy model visible to it.  All models within a X" radius of the model targeted by the Blast Radius weapon must take an test on a d10: Needing a result equal or below to their Movement and Initiative Combined. Those Models (or Models of a Unit) that fail, is attacked by the weapon's profile; ignoring the Blast Radius(X) Keyword. You resolve these attacks after the original model/unit's attack is concluded.


If Multiple Models of a Unit would cause multiple attacks, instead add all the attacks together.


(Example. If 3 Models of a Unit fail a Blast Radius Test from a Weapon with 3 Attacks, then the unit would suffer 9 WPN Dice.)
sharedRules.name: Blast Radius(X)

sharedRules.description: When one or more WPN dice from this weapon hits an enemy unit or model, that unit/model must suffer a Pinning Test but with a negative modifier of (X) to their discipline d10 roll.
sharedRules.name: Pinning Fire(X)

sharedRules.description: When one or more WPN dice from this weapon hits an enemy unit or model, that unit/model must suffer a Suppression Test but with a negative modifier of (X) to their discipline d10 roll.
sharedRules.name: Suppressive Fire(X)

sharedRules.description: A weapon with this special rule may be used in a Melee Attack action after the Attack has ended. If a model has two weapons that have the One-Handed keyword, they may be both used for a shooting action. If a model has multiple One-Handed keyword weapons, only one can be chosen for the additional attack during Melee. For identical weapons, unless specified, their special rules only apply once.
sharedRules.name: One-Handed

sharedRules.description: An item with this special rule can only be used (X) times per game.
sharedRules.name: Limited Use(X)

sharedRules.description: This Weapon has the Moving Fire (2) Rule.This weapon fills 1 Ranged Weapon Option on a model.
sharedRules.name: Carbine

sharedRules.description: A weapon with this special rule does not have a fixed Weapon Dice count; only able to use up to (X) WPN Dice. For example, Overheat(3) means a total of 3 WPN Dice can be used before the following occurs: After (X) WPN Dice has been used, this weapon goes into Overheated. An Overheated weapon cannot be fired for any Overwatch or Shooting Actions until the end of their next activation. For example, a Weapon that overheated on Round 1 may be fired against on Round 3.
sharedRules.name: Overheat

sharedRules.description: A weapon with this special rule must roll a d6 for every WPN Dice it rolled in the "Hit" step, and for each result of 1, that model suffers (X) Damage. If a model with a weapon that has this special rule is in a unit, if it dies from it's Overcharged d6s and some d6s are remaining, then you may discard them.
sharedRules.name: Overcharged(X)

sharedRules.description: A weapon with this special rule does not suffer any penalty unlike other Machine Guns. This weapon fills 1 Ranged Weapon Option on a model, only a weapon with the Pistol keyword can be taken in addition to it. Only Melee Weapons with the Concealed Weapon type may be equipped to this model.
sharedRules.name: Light Machine Gun

sharedRules.description: A weapon with this special rule gains +1 AP and Strength when the target model/unit is within half range. A Shotgun has the Moving Fire(1) rule. This weapon fills 1 Ranged Weapon Slot on a model.
sharedRules.name: Shotgun

sharedRules.description: A Concealed Weapon does not occupy a Melee Weapon Slot. A singular Concealed Weapon does not occupy a Melee Weapon Slot, two Concealed Weapons do occupy Melee Weapon Slot; only one may be selected for Melee Attacks. A model using a Concealed Weapon for Melee has +1 Initiative.
sharedRules.name: Concealed Weapon

sharedRules.description: Wildworld Pioneers: A Model/Unit with this special rule may ignore the Penalties of a Forest or Swamp Terrain Feature.
sharedRules.name: Cilian Iron Claws

sharedRules.description: Lunar Pioneers: A Model/Unit with this special rule may ignore the Penalties of a Void-BorneTerrain Feature.
sharedRules.name: Luptal Wolves

sharedRules.description: A weapon with this rule ignores the Toughness Characteristic of the target model/unit.
sharedRules.name: Energy

sharedRules.description: A weapon with this special rule may always be equipped to a model that has a weapon that allows a bayonet. A bayonet may be chosen as a melee weapon during a charge action, if so, it gains +1 Strength until the end of that Melee Attack.
sharedRules.name: Bayonet

sharedRules.description: A Melee, or Melee Weapon, can be selected to be used for Melee Combat, where two models/units engage in Melee Combat. A Melee Weapon ignores the "Hit" Dice step and goes straight to the "Wound" Dice Step of WPN Dice. Range on Melee Weapons is the range that you can move the model to an enemy model to reach base-to-base, where you carry out Melee Combat. If you charge, you double your movement value and then use the weapon's range to move into base-to-base. Melee Combat descends from the highest initiative down to the lowest; 10 to 1. If two units/models/models in a unit have the same initiative, then the unit that declared and used a action to perform a Melee Attack will attack first. For example, if Unit 1 and Unit 2 are fighting with both units being at Initiative 4, since Unit 1 declared the Melee Action, then they will resolve their Initiative 4 Attacks first.
sharedRules.name: Melee

sharedRules.description: A Melee weapon with this special rule may reduce all of it's WPN Dice count to 1 and reduce the model's initiative by the dice reduced, however the weapon's Strength is increased by the amount of the dice reduced.
sharedRules.name: Crushing Blow

sharedRules.description: A Melee weapon with this special rule when chosen to be used in a Melee Attack, the model equipped with this may reduce it's WPN dice count by (X) but increase it's Initiative by (X).
sharedRules.name: Duelist(X)

sharedRules.description: A Weapon with this special rule does not need to be in base-to-base for Melee Attacks.It may use it's range characteristic as normally; rather than moving into Base-to-Base with an Enemy Model or Unit.
sharedRules.name: Reach

sharedRules.description: Any Model/Unit within 12 and line of sight of a Banner adds +1 to their Discipline and Willpower Stat. If there are multiple Banners or variants of banners present, choose one to gain benefit from: For example, you do not gain +4 Discipline and Willpower from 4 Banners, only one of your choice.
sharedRules.name: Banner

sharedRules.description: A
sharedRules.name: Retinu

sharedRules.description: Challenger: A Unit with the Challenger Special Rule may attempt to issue a Challenge for their activation. If a Character with this special rule attaches to a unit without the special rule, then the unit gains the Special Rule.
sharedRules.name: Challenger

sharedRules.description:
Challenge: At the start of this Unit's activation, it may use it's activation to issue a challenge to an Enemy Unit within line of sight. That enemy unit must be in Charge or Melee Weapon distance. The Enemy player may accept or deny the Challenge. If the enemy decides to deny, they must take a Willpower Test. 


If the Enemy Unit accepts the Challenge, every model in that unit without the Challenger special rule must take a test (using their morale value) to participate in the challenge. Enemy models with the Challenger special rule do not have to make this test.
After deciding those participating in a challenge, no other enemy or friendly unit can perform any attacks against the units participating in the challenge.
Proceed (MS) combat as normal.
The unit that removes the most models from the other enemy unit and survives is the winner, earning 1 Victory Point.
sharedRules.name: Challenge

sharedRules.description: A Model/Unit with the Glory in Combat(X) special rule earns Victory Points equal to the number of brackets whenever that Model/unit destroys an enemy unit.If there is multiple Glory in Combat(X) in a unit, the highest is earned; the others are ignored.
sharedRules.name: Glory in Combat (X)

sharedRules.description: A Model or Unit with this special rule is treated as a Retinue. Orderlies share the same slot as the CHARACTER it is joined to. If an attack
sharedRules.name: Orderlies

sharedRules.description: You may allocate damage to any chosen model in an enemy unit. However, any left-over damage after the chosen model is killed is ignored.
sharedRules.name: Precision

sharedRules.description: Any Model or Unit that has this Special Rule rolls 2d10 for their Willpower and Discipline tests; choosing the worst out of the two.
sharedRules.name: Conscript

sharedRules.description:
A Unit or Model with this special rule suffers from the modifiers below:
• A Unit with this special rule suffers a fall back test if they take more casualties than inflicted in Melee Combat.
• A Unit with this special rule suffers a -1 to their Ballistic Skill if their shooting target is more than half their weapon's range away from them.
sharedRules.name: Inexperienced

sharedRules.description:
For every (X) models armed with this weapon, gain an additional +1 WPN Dice when using it.

Example: 14 Models armed with a rifle that both have 1 WPN Dice and the gunline(2) keyword, means that they'll get to add 7 more WPN Dice to their original total of 14; making it 21.
sharedRules.name: Gunline (X)

sharedRules.description: A Unit with the Bodyguard Special Rule may be attached to any friendly Character model that is not attached to a Unit or Retinue already, and may always participate in Challenges even though they themselves do not have the Challenger keyword.
sharedRules.name: Bodyguard

sharedRules.description: After concluding an attack with this weapon, count the number of unsaved damage caused by this weapon on the enemy target. Immediately resole a number of additional WPN Dice that automatically passed the "Hit" Step of WPN Dice rolls, and are not effected by any modifiers whatsoever unless stated otherwise. These additional hits do not inflict more hits by this special rule.
sharedRules.name: Deflagration

sharedRules.description:
A weapon with this special rule that is equipped to a model reduces that model's Initiative characteristic to 1 for the sake of Melee Combat. 
If this keyword is on a (BS) Weapon, then the model equipped with this weapon also suffers a -1 BS penalty whenever it performs a shooting action after a movement action.
sharedRules.name: Unwieldy Weapon

sharedRules.description: A (BS) Weapon with this special rule gains +1 BS if the Model equipped with it has not performed any movement action during it's current activation.
sharedRules.name: Heavy

sharedRules.description:
Vehicle Unit Type Special Rule:
• A vehicle can never be the target of Any Mental Statuses.
• A Vehicle has Hull Points where the amount of damage dealt in a single activation has to be equal or less than the Hull Point value remove one Hull point when this clause is filled. Attacks against vehicles use the Current Hull Point value as a penalty during the HIT Step and then supplement the Armor Facing Value as Toughness for the second step.
•Instead of using Toughness for the second WPN Dice step, they use their DEF value.
• All vehicles have directional armor, discuss with your opponent with what sides are what.
• When a Vehicle loses all of it's Hull Points, takes damage from a weapon that has a weapon that has strength double it's toughness, refer to the Vehicle Damage Table.
sharedRules.name: Unit Type: Vehicle

sharedRules.description:
Rather than performing a Charge action, a Vehicle instead performs a Ramming Action. 


To perform a Ramming attack, turn/pivot the Vehicle on the spot to face the direction you intend to move it in, and just like a charge action, it must be able to target an elgible enemy unit prior to declaring a charge action. However, a Ramming attack may also target fortifications. A Ramming Action's Strength is based on the Armor Value of the Front Armor Facing of the Ramming Vehicle with automatic WPN Dice hits equal to the amount of models in the Enemy Unit that was rammed.

If the Ramming vehicle comes into contact with an Enemy Vehicle or Fortifications, you use the Armor facing that is in contact with the Ramming vehicle, and has 1 WPN Dice that automatically hits.

Any INFANTRY Unit that are the target of a Ramming Attack must take a Discipline Check, and if they fail, they Fall-Back.
sharedRules.name: Vehicle Ramming Action

sharedRules.description:
Vehicle units with this special rule may have units transported inside of them.

A Vehicle of this special rule may have (X) INFANTRY Models embarked inside of it, however the models cannot reach past capacity or be partial of a Unit. For example, a Vehicle with Transport (4) Cannot transport a 5-Model Strong Unit.
sharedRules.name: Transport(X)

sharedRules.description:
This special rule is to represent the crew of any vehicle, field gun or any other weapon.

The Crewmen is one unit of (X) Models, that can always disembark and Re-Embark of the Unit they crew; following the exact same rules of Disembarking and Re-Embarking like normal units would do with Transports.

Units without their dedicated crew cannot perform any actions whatsoever until they Re-Embark into the vehicle again.


For example, an Artillery Platform cannot be used until the Crew Re-Embarks the Artillery Platform again.
sharedRules.name: Crewmen(X)

sharedRules.description:
Embarking: Any Friendly Unit within 3 inches of a Friendly Unit may choose to enter a Transport(X) Vehicle. Remove the models off the table until they Disembark. Embarking is one action, but also can be done for free at the end of a normal movement action if they are already within range to do so.

Disembark: To Disembark, choose a friendly unit within the transport(X) Vehicle and they are put back on the table up to Y amount of inches; Y being equal to their movement characteristic. This does not cost an action.

If a Model with the Transport Sub-Type has a Unit Embarked upon it, the Embarked Unit is not considered part of the same Unit. The two remain separate Units for all purposes.
sharedRules.name: Embarking/Disembarking

sharedRules.description:
A Model with this special rule has the Indirect Fire Special Rule.
Damage: An Artillery Model must be targeted over it's crewmen, special rules such as Blast Radius and Precision Ignores this. For every unsaved WPN Dice in the "Wound" step, roll a d10 on the Artillery Damage Table.
Movement Restriction:An Artillery Model that has performed a movement action during it's activation cannot be fired again until it's next activation.
Crewmen Weapons:Crewmen of an Artillery Model may either choose to use their own weapons on their models or the Artillery Piece they are crewing.
sharedRules.name: Artillery

sharedRules.description:
If an Artillery Model suffers any unsaved WPN Dice damage, you roll a d10; adding +1 for every Unsaved WPN Dice after the first. For example, 7 unsaved WPN dice equals a d10 with a +6 Modifier.


1-2: Nothing Happens!
3-4: Rattling Fire:The Artillery Crewmen suffer a Pinning Test.
5-6: Crew Shaken: The Crew of the Artillery Piece takes a Discipline Test, if they fail, they cannot perform any attack via Indirect Fire until their next activation.
7-9:Mechanical Damage: Any shooting attacks with an Artillery Model's weapon profile worsens all "Hit" WPN Dice rolls by 1. This Penalty stays for the rest of the game until repaired.
10: On Fire: The Artillery Model burst out in flames, all Crewmen that are manning the weapon suffer 1 Automatic WPN Dice Hit with Strength equal to the Artillery Weapon's Strength. Any Crewmen that survive performs a Fall-Back in any direction away from the Artillery Model.
sharedRules.name: Artillery Damage Table

sharedRules.description: A Model/Unit that is Suppressed cannot perform any Shooting Actions and cannot perform Overwatch Actions until the end of their Activation. A Unit can remove Suppressed with a Discipline Test.
sharedRules.name: Mental Status: Suppressed

sharedRules.description: Any Model or Unit that is Pinned must spend it's next activation removing the status effect with a Willpower Test. If it succeeds, then it can activate with 1 action remaining. If it fails, the Stunned is removed at the end of their activation.
sharedRules.name: Mental Status: Stunned

sharedRules.description:
This Mental Status is applied to any Model/Unit that has performed the Fall Back Action. 

A Model/Unit with this Mental Status cannot perform any Movement action whatsoever until the end of their activation, or they performed a Fall-Back after their activation ended, they cannot move until the end of their next activation instead.
sharedRules.name: Mental Status:Fallen Back

sharedRules.description: A Model/Unit with this Mental Status cannot perform any action besides performing Fall Back movements equal to their movement value. They continue this until they pass a Willpower Test which is taken at the end of their activation.
sharedRules.name: Mental Status: Panic!

sharedRules.description: A Model/Unit that is Pinned halve their Ballistic Skill and Melee Skill(Rounding UP), and cannot perform Overwatch Actions. A Unit can remove Pinned with a Discipline Test.
sharedRules.name: Mental Status: Pinnned

sharedRules.description:
A Fall Back is a forced movement action.

A Fall Back forces a Model/Unit to move directly backwards on a d6, and stops it's movement short if there is a Piece of Terrain, Unit, etc. in the way.
sharedRules.name: Fall Back

sharedRules.description: Any Model or Unit that is Death-Rattled cannot perform any action whatsoever. Any Melee Combat that targets and causes any amount of unsaved WPN Dice will remove this Model/Unit in it's entirety.
sharedRules.name: Mental Status: Death-Rattle

sharedRules.description: A weapon with this Special Rule ignores the “Hit” step of WPN Dice rolling when it is used. After performing a (BS) Shooting attack with weapon, the target enemy Unit must take a Willpower Test. If they fail, they gain the Panic! Mental Status. If they succeed, they perform a Fall Back Action.
sharedRules.name: Flamethrower

sharedRules.description: At the start of each action, the Model/Unit with this status effect rolls takes damage from the brackets. The Model may use an action to put out the fire and remove the status effect. If Burning is on a Unit rather than a singular model, the damage is distributed to a model in the unit by the player until no damage remains.
sharedRules.name: Burning(X)

sharedRules.description: A Unit that is scattered cannot perform any other movement action besides moving back into Coherency until they return to Coherency; you can only move forward if that means the unit would return to coherency. Instead of doing normal movement actions, one rolls 2d6+Movement Value for Movement to regain coherency, ending their activation as soon as they do.If a squad has no feasible way to re-gain coherency, then the two (or more) parts of the squad out of coherency become two squads out of the one.
sharedRules.name: Scattered Unit

sharedRules.description:
When a Unit/Model within 3 inches takes a casualty, roll a d6 for each model removed. On 4+, a model is restored to that unit. If this model starts it's activation, it may do this as an action; costing one action for it's activation. 



If instead of a Unit, a Model, within 3 inches takes damage, roll a d6 for every unsaved WPN Dice roll and on a 4+, negate one of those dice. If this model starts it's activation, it may instead the model, rolling a d6 for every missing HP, on a 4+ restore a HP.
sharedRules.name: Medic

sharedRules.description: A Model or Unit with this Special rule cannot be targeted by (BS) attacks, Challenges, Blast Radius or Indirect Fire weapons. This model can never score for objectives and if it is killed, no victory points can be earned. If an enemy unit attempts to charge or target this model with a (MS) attack, they must take a Discipline test to do so and if they fail, the action fails.
sharedRules.name: Non-Combatant

sharedRules.description:
The Vehicle Damage table is triggered when it’s Hullpoints are reduced to 0 for the first time, takes damage from a weapon that has strength double it's DEF Value or any other specified instances.

For every unsaved WPN Dice, roll a d10 for the list below, a vehicle cannot have the same status effect applied again when it already has it:
1: The Vehicle Explodes. All Crew Members and Transported Models are killed and count as casualties. Roll 2d6 for a Blast Radius, then all units within that range must take 2d6 damage. 
2: The Vehicle breaks down completely, it's weapon or special abilities can longer be used. Crew members and transported units must disembark.
3: When this vehicle would take a movement action, it's movement characteristic is halved and cannot ram.
4-6: The Crew inside must take an Intelligence Check, if they fail, the vehicle cannot be moved until a Intelligence Check Action is passed.
7-9: This Vehicle suffers no further damage.
10: A Hull point is Recovered on the vehicle.
sharedRules.name: Vehicle Damage Table

sharedRules.description:
When a Weapon with this Special Rule is used against a Vehicle, the following occurs:
• They treat the Armor Facing they are targeting as the Rear Armor Facing of the Vehicle for the sake of dealing Hull Point Damage.
• If they are already targeting the Rear Armor Facing, they ignore it entirely for the sake of dealing Hull Point Damage. 
•Vehicles remove 2 Hull Points instead of 1 from an attack of this weapon. 
•If a targeted vehicle has no Hull Points remaining, this weapon double's it's damage profile against it.
sharedRules.name: Anti-Armor

sharedRules.description:
Automata Unit Type Special Rule:
• The Poison and Bleed Special Rule is negated against models of the Automata Unit Type.
• Any models with the Automata Unit Type may not Overwatch.
•Automata Models/Units cannot gain any Mental Status.
•Automata Models/Units do not have to take Willpower or Discipline Tests.
• No model that is not also of the Automata Unit Type may join a unit that includes an Automata model.
sharedRules.name: Unit Type: Automata

sharedRules.description:
Walker Unit-type:
• The Poison and Bleed Special Rule is negated against models of the Walker Unit Type.
• Walker Models/Units do not have to take Willpower or Discipline Tests.
• No model that is not also of the Walker Unit Type may join a unit that includes a Walker model.
sharedRules.name: Unit Type:Walker

sharedRules.description:
To use a Field Torpedo, the following must occur:
• The Target of this weapon must be a Obstruction or Light Fortification Type.
• The Model/Unit with a Field Torpedo must be within distance equal of their initiative to use the Field Torpedo; then they must move that far away.
• Then conclude by using the Field Torpedo weapon profile.
sharedRules.name: Field Torpedo

sharedRules.description:
To use a Demolition Charge, the following must occur:
• The Target of this weapon must be a Obstruction, Fortification, Vehicle Type.
• The Model/Unit with a Demolition Charge must be within distance equal of their initiative to use the Field Torpedo; then they must move that far away. 
•  The Model/Unit with the Demolition Charge now planted must take an Intelligence Check, if they succeed, they get to use the weapon profile and resolve the attack at Initiative 10. If they fail, they must wait until their next activation to use the Demolition Charge; Costing an one Action.



This Process costs one action, unless they fail the Intelligence Check; costing one Action on their next activation to use the Demolition Charge.


Any Models within a Fortification, Obstruction or Vehicle also suffer the unsaved WPN Dice Damage from the Demolition Charge, and must allocate the damage until no damage remains.
sharedRules.name: Demolition Charge
Artillery Coordination
sharedRules.description:
A Model with this special Rule may be used to draw line of sight for the sake of Indirect Fire and Artillery Weapons.


Artillery Coordination: At the start of the game, it selects one Artillery Unit to Coordinate. When that Coordinated Unit uses a Indirect Fire Weapon, it can use the Coordinator for line of sight. If it is able to, an Artillery Coordinator may also join the Crew of the Unit it is Coordinating, acting as +1 to it's Crew(X) and may use it's Intelligence Characteristic for the Unit's Indirect Fire Test.

sharedRules.name: Indirect Fire
sharedRules.description:
A weapon with this special rule may be used against targets not visible to it, however before the "Hit" step of the WPN Dice, An intelligence check of the model/unit equipped with the Indirect Weapon must be taken, if it fails, that model/unit equipped with that weapon suffers -2 to Hit.

If the weapon also has Blast Radius(X), if the Intelligence Dice Fails, rolls a scatter dice and a d6; to determine the direction and movement of the Blast Radius(X) Weapon.

A weapon with this special rule worsens the "to-Hit" roll by 2 if the Model equipped with it has performed a movement action prior to it being used . This weapon fills 1 Ranged Weapon Option on a model, only a weapon with the Pistol keyword can be taken in addition to it. Only Melee Weapons with the Concealed Weapon type may be equipped to this model.
sharedRules.name: Medium Machine Gun

sharedRules.description: A weapon with this special rule cannot be used if the model equipped with it has performed a movement action prior to it being used . This weapon fills 1 Ranged Weapon Option on a model, no other ranged weaponcan be taken in addition to it. Only Melee Weapons with the Concealed Weapon type may be equipped to this model.
sharedRules.name: Heavy Machine Gun
Lobotomite
sharedRules.description: Whenever a model with this special rule is called to make an Intelligence Check, their intelligence value is randomized by d10 prior to it.

characteristics.$text: When a Model ends a movement within 6 inches of a Flux-Star, it must take an d10 Test, rolling equal or under: Combining both Initiative and Toughness. If the result is
characteristics.name: Description

characteristics.$text: If a Unit would suffer 25% or 50% of it's model count due to a shooting attack, it must take a Pinning Test. A Pinning Test is resolved on a d10 with the result being equal or below to the highest Discipline value in the Unit. If they fail, their movement value is reduced to (1) and they cannot perform a charge action until they perform and pass a Mental Test Resolve action to do so.
characteristics.name: Description

characteristics.$text: MK-1b "Dome-Head" SAPPA provides a 9+ Primary Save against Ballistic Weapons and confers a 6+ Primary Save against Environmental Damage and Radiation Weapons.
characteristics.name: Description

characteristics.$text: MK-1c "Hex-Glass" SAPPA provides a 7+ Primary Save against Energy Weapon Attacks and when a Energy Weapon targets this Model/Unit, it loses the Energy Weapon rule against it.
